column4: I'm having problems installing java, when I try to run a program i get an exception with java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError, I think i'm missing PATHS but I dont know what I need
you need your classpath env variable to contain whatever jar or file you need to run, what program are you trying to run?
thanks for the reply, its reprap-host.sh

you can also set the classpath on the java command line with the -cp flag, ussually java programs come with some sort of shell script to start them with the right classpath, where didyou install this from?
are you running it from the folder where reprap.jar is>
did you install java from the ubuntu package? sun-java5-jre or sun-java6-jre?
when I type java -cp I get -cp requires class path specification, and I'm using sun-java5-jre from the ubuntu repository
well in this case the program is only one jar and it's specified in the sh script with -jar on the command line, so defining a classpath isn't your issue in this case
I know, I just downloaded it, so the error is this javax/vecmath/Tuple3d error?
yeah that vecmath library is not installed by default in ubuntu, trying to find out how to instlal it now, but I don't know
thanks, i can find it, I know what the real problem is now. thanks for the help!
I found the java3d.jar file the reprap page links to is really an html file not the real java3d.jar, that will fix my problem
